---
title: Supersymmetric gauge theories - 2
---
 
<h4>Organizational information</h4>
<p>
<b>Every Wednesdays, starting 07-March-2017, at 16:00 Hrs at the Seminar room on the 10th Floor (Yellow tower, Freihaus, TU Wien, Wiedner Hauptstr. 8-10 1040 Vienna). </b> <br>Please <a href="/"> contact</a>  me in case of further information or clarifications. <br>


<h4> Topics</h4>
<ol>
<li> N = 1 dualities </li>
<li> N = 2 dualities</li>
<li> AGT conjecture </li>
<li> Argyres-Douglas type CFT's</li>
<li> Class S theories and spectral networks </li>
<li> Wall crossing phenomena in various dimensions</li>
<li> Geometric Langlands correspondence</li>
</ol>

<br>
<h4> Pre-requisites </h4> 
A good grasp of quantum field theory, differential geometry and supersymmetry is required for this course. It is beneficial to have attended the first half of the course i.e <a href = "SW1"> supersymmetric gauge theories </a>.
<br><br>

<h4> Literature </h4>
<br>

<h5> Dualities </h5>

<li> <a href = "http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/0370269377900764"> Magnetic monopoles as gauge particles </a> (Original paper, there are many freely accessible books and articles which summarize this paper very well. Please get in touch if you want access to this paper.)
<li> <a href = "https://inspirehep.net/record/818218?ln=en" > N=2 dualities</a></li>
<li> <a href = "https://arxiv.org/src/1608.02952/anc/LocQFT.pdf" > Localization Techniques in Quantum Field Theories</a> (Chapter 12)</li> 
<li> <a href = "https://arxiv.org/abs/0906.3219" > Liouville Correlation Functions from Four-dimensional Gauge Theories</a>(Original AGT paper, for review - see Ch. 12 above)</li>

<h5> Integrability and Localization</h5>
<li> <a href = "https://arxiv.org/abs/hep-th/9912271" > Lectures on Supersymmetric Yang-Mills Theory and Integrable Systems
</a></li>
<li> <a href = "https://arxiv.org/abs/1111.4234"> Notes on supersymmetric and holomorphic field theories in dimensions 2 and 4 </a> </li> 
<li> <a href = "https://arxiv.org/src/1608.02952/anc/LocQFT.pdf" > Localization Techniques in Quantum Field Theories</a> (Chapters 1 and 3)</li> 
<li> <a href = "https://arxiv.org/abs/hep-th/9510101"> Supersymmetric Yang-Mills Systems And Integrable Systems</a> </li> 


<h5> Argyres-Douglas CFT's </h5>
